name: insulate
content:
insulate verb [T]
(COVER)
Add to word list
Add to word list
to cover and surround something with a material or substance in order to stop heat, sound, or electricity from escaping or entering: insulate something against something You can insulate a house against heat loss by having the windows double-glazed.

insulate verb [T]
(PROTECT)
to protect someone or something from harmful experiences or influences: be insulated from Children should be insulated from the horrors of war. Until recently the country's economy has been insulated from recession by its reserves of raw materials.

(COVER)
Add to word list
Add to word list
to use a material to cover or go around the surface of something in order to prevent heat, electricity, etc., from escaping or entering: We’ve saved a lot on our heating bills by insulating the attic.
insulate verb [T]
(PROTECT)
to protect someone or something from outside influences: As a member of a rich and powerful family, she was insulated from ordinary life.
Add to word list
Add to word list
to protect someone or something from something that might harm them or it: insulate sb/sth against/from sth Firms producing basic necessities are better insulated from the effects of a recession.
